Mikado.parsers package¶

Submodules¶

Mikado.parsers.GFF module¶

Module to serialize GFF files.

class Mikado.parsers.GFF.GFF3(handle)[source]¶

Bases: Mikado.parsers.Parser

Class that is used to parse a GFF file.

class Mikado.parsers.GFF.GffLine(line, my_line='', header=False)[source]¶

Bases: Mikado.parsers.gfannotation.GFAnnotation

Object which serializes a GFF line.

derived_from¶

Property, Set to True if the key “Derives_from” is present among the instance attributes.

gene¶

Property. If the feature is a transcript, returns the parent; else, it returns None (as only transcript lines have the gene among the attributes) :rtype str

id¶

Returns the ID of the feature. :rtype str

is_derived¶

Property. It checks whether there is a “Derives_from” attribute among the line attributes. :rtype bool

is_parent¶

Property. True if the feature has no parent defined. :rtype bool

is_transcript¶

Property. True if the feature is an RNA, false otherwise. :rtype bool

name¶

Returns the name of the feature. It defaults to the ID if missing.

:rtype str

parent¶

This property looks up the “Parent” field in the “attributes” dictionary. Contrary to other attributes, this property returns a list, not a string. This is due to the fact that GFF files support multiple inheritance by separating the parent entries with a comma.

:rtype list

transcript¶

Property. If the feature is a transcript, it returns the id; if it is an exon, it returns the parent; else, it returns None

:rtype str :rtype list :rtype None

Mikado.parsers.GTF module¶

Generic parser for GTF files.

class Mikado.parsers.GTF.GTF(handle)[source]¶

Bases: Mikado.parsers.Parser

The parsing class.

class Mikado.parsers.GTF.GtfLine(line, my_line='', header=False)[source]¶

Bases: Mikado.parsers.gfannotation.GFAnnotation

This class defines a typical GTF line, with some added functionality to make it useful in e.g. parsing cufflinks GTF files or creating GTF lines from scratch. Fields: - chrom - source - feature - start,end - score - phase - strand - info (a dictionary containing all the annotations contained in the last field)

  • gene: the gene_id
  • transcript: the transcript_id

For cufflinks files, also: - nearest_ref - tss_id - ccode

derived_from¶

Boolean property. True if the GTF line has a “derives_from” tag, False otherwise.

frame¶

Frame of the GTF record line. It can be one of None, 0, 1, 2. :return:

gene¶

Return the “gene_id” field. :rtype : str | None

id¶

ID of the line. “transcript_id” for transcript features, None in all other cases. :rtype : str | None

is_derived¶

Property. It checks whether there is a “Derives_from” attribute among the line attributes. :rtype bool

is_gene¶

In a GTF this should always evaluate to False

is_parent¶

True if we are looking at a transcript, False otherwise. :rtype : bool

is_transcript¶

Flag. True if feature is “transcript” or contains “RNA”, False in all other cases. :rtype : bool

name¶

Returns the name of the feature. It defaults to the ID if missing. :rtype str

parent¶

This property looks up the “Parent” field in the “attributes” dictionary. If the line is a transcript line, it returns the gene field. Otherwise, it returns the transcript field. In order to maintain interface consistency with the GFF objects and contrary to other attributes, this property returns a list, not a string. This is due to the fact that GFF files support multiple inheritance by separating the parent entries with a comma.

:rtype : list

phase¶
transcript¶

This property returns the “transcript_id” field of the GTF line. :rtype : str

Mikado.parsers.bed12 module¶

Module to parse BED12 objects. Much more basic than what PyBedtools could offer, but at the same time more pythonic.

class Mikado.parsers.bed12.BED12(*args: str, *, fasta_index=None, transcriptomic=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

BED12 parsing class.

cds_len¶

Return the length of the internal feature i.e. the CDS: thickEnd-thickStart+1

:rtype int

full_orf¶

Property. True if the BED12 is transcriptomic and has both start and stop codon, False otherwise. :rtype bool

has_start_codon¶

Property. True if the interval contains a start codon. :rtype bool :rtype None

has_stop_codon¶

Property. True if the interval contains a termination codon. :rtype bool :rtype None

id¶

Property. It returns the name of the feature. :rtype str

invalid¶

Property. It performs basic checks on the BED line to verify its integrity. :rtype bool

strand¶

Strand of the feature. It must be one of None,+,- :rtype None | str

transcriptomic¶

Flag. If set to True, it indicates the BED contains transcriptomic rather than genomic coordinates. :rtype bool

class Mikado.parsers.bed12.Bed12Parser(handle, fasta_index=None, transcriptomic=False)[source]¶

Bases: Mikado.parsers.Parser

Parser class for a Bed12Parser file. It accepts optionally a fasta index which is used to determine whether an ORF has start/stop codons.

close()[source]¶

Mikado.parsers.blast_utils module¶

This module contains generic-purpose utilities to deal with BLAST XML files.

class Mikado.parsers.blast_utils.BlastOpener(filename)[source]¶

Bases: object

close()[source]¶
open()[source]¶
read(*args)[source]¶
sniff(default_header=None)[source]¶

Method that either derives the default XML header for the instance (if undefined) or checks that the given file is compatible with it. :param default_header: optional default header to check for consistency :return: boolean (passed or not passed) :rtype: (bool, list, str)

class Mikado.parsers.blast_utils.XMLMerger(filenames, log_level=30, log=None)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

This class has the purpose of merging on the fly multiple BLAST alignment files, be they in XML, XML.gz, or ASN.gz format. It uses the _Merger private class as a background process which bothers itself with the real work, while this class provides a file-like interface for external applications such Bio.Blast.NCBIXML.parse.

close()[source]¶
logger = <logging.Logger object>¶
read(size=None)[source]¶

This method allows the XMLMerger class to act, for all purposes, like a file-like interface. The bytes are read from the queue, delivered by the background _Merger instance. :param size: optional parameter to indicate how much we want to read from the file-like interface. :return:

run()[source]¶

Method to start the process. Override of the original Thread method. :return:

Mikado.parsers.blast_utils.check_beginning(handle, filename, previous_header)[source]¶

Static method to check that the beginning of the XML file is actually correct.

Parameters:
  • handle – handle to the file to check.
  • filename (str) – name of the file associated with the handle.
  • previous_header – header found in previous file(s).

It is used the parameter used for the consinstency check. :type previous_header: (None | list)

:return

Mikado.parsers.blast_utils.merge()[source]¶

This function is used to merge together intervals, which have to be supplied as a list of duplexes - (start,stop). The function will then merge together overlapping tuples and return a list of non-overlapping tuples. If the list is composed by only one element, the function returns immediately. :param intervals: a list of integer duplexes :type intervals: list

Mikado.parsers.gfannotation module¶

This module describes an abstract class which underlies the parsing of GTF/GFF files.

class Mikado.parsers.gfannotation.GFAnnotation(line, my_line='', header=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

This abstract class describes a generic GTF/GFF annotation line. The parsers for those two type of files inherit from this abstract class, which defines common methods and properties.

copy()[source]¶

Wrapper around the copy.copy function.

is_cds¶

This property evaluates to True if the row describes a CDS/UTR segment, False otherwise.

is_exon¶

Property. True if the feature is CDS/exon/UTR/start or stop codon. :rtype bool

is_gene¶

Property. True if the feature ends with “gene” and has no parents. :rtype bool

phase¶

Property. Stores the phase of the feature. Valid values: None, 0, 1 ,2 :return:

score¶

Score value. Either None or float. :rtype float | None

strand¶

Strand attribute. One of None, +, - :rtype str | None

Module contents¶

This module defines the iterators that will parse BED12, GTF, GFF files.

exception Mikado.parsers.HeaderError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Mock exception which is raised when a header/comment line (e.g. starting with “#”) is found.

Bases: object

Generic parser iterator. Base parser class.

Alias for __exit__

Boolean flag. If True, the file has been closed already.
